title: Evaluating Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) After Strong Recent Momentum And Mixed Valuation Signals
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) has shown strong recent momentum with significant share price returns over one, three, and twelve months. While current valuations present a mixed picture, with one narrative suggesting the stock is 7% overvalued based on a fair value of US$310, the market's P/E ratio for TSM is still below the industry average, implying a potential discount. The company is highlighted as a central pillar of the AI revolution, but risks like geopolitical tensions and cost pressures are noted.

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Announces Strategic Collaboration With NVIDIA Leveraging AI to Advance Scientific Instrumentation and Accelerate Laboratory Performance
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific is collaborating with NVIDIA to integrate AI into scientific instrumentation and laboratory automation. This partnership aims to enhance the speed, accuracy, and efficiency of laboratory processes by leveraging NVIDIA's AI platform and models like NeMo and BioNeMo, alongside Thermo Fisher's lab expertise. The goal is to reduce manual tasks, democratize scientific discovery, and accelerate breakthroughs in life sciences.

title: Applied Materials Stock: Riding The AI Hardware Wave While Valuations Get Tested
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) has become a crucial supplier to the AI and advanced chip industry, experiencing significant stock appreciation despite recent volatility. Analysts are largely constructive on the stock, with most maintaining "Buy" equivalent ratings and expecting further upside. The company's future performance hinges on AI-related capital spending, the broader semiconductor cycle, and geopolitical factors, with the market cautiously optimistic about its central role in the ecosystem.

title: Thermo Fisher se une à NVIDIA para desenvolver soluções laboratoriais com IA
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific está colaborando com a NVIDIA para desenvolver soluções de automação laboratorial baseadas em IA. Esta parceria visa melhorar a precisão e a velocidade nos laboratórios, integrando instrumentos científicos com a infraestrutura de IA da NVIDIA, incluindo o supercomputador DGX Spark e modelos como NeMo e BioNeMo. A colaboração procura criar sistemas laboratoriais mais intuitivos e reduzir tarefas manuais para acelerar o avanço nas ciências da vida.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: MKS Inc. Unveils Photonics Solutions to Advance AI, Quantum, and Biotech at Photonics West 2026
summary: MKS Inc. (NASDAQ: MKSI) will showcase its latest photonics solutions for AI, quantum computing, biophotonics, security, and advanced manufacturing at Photonics West 2026. The company will feature products like Newport HybrYX stages, Spectra-Physics Talon Ace lasers, and InSight X3+ tunable lasers, highlighting its "Surround the Workpiece" strategy for end-to-end solutions. The announcement comes as MKS stock trades above its 200-day moving average, despite no new revenue or guidance figures being provided.

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Announces Strategic Collaboration With NVIDIA Leveraging AI to Advance Scientific Instrumentation and Accelerate Laboratory Performance
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific has announced a strategic collaboration with NVIDIA to integrate AI into scientific instrumentation and accelerate laboratory performance. This partnership aims to modernize lab processes, improve accuracy, and speed up scientific discoveries by leveraging NVIDIA's AI platform, including DGX Spark, NeMo, and BioNeMo, with Thermo Fisher's lab technologies. The goal is to create more intuitive and automated laboratory workflows, ultimately amplifying productivity in life sciences research.

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Announces Strategic Collaboration With NVIDIA Leveraging AI to Advance Scientific Instrumentation and Accelerate Laboratory Performance
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific has announced a strategic collaboration with NVIDIA to integrate AI-based solutions and laboratory automation. This partnership aims to leverage NVIDIA's AI platform and Thermo Fisher's scientific instruments to enhance automation, accuracy, and speed in laboratories. The objective is to reduce manual tasks for scientists, accelerate scientific advancement, and create an integrated environment where data, instruments, and software work together with AI to boost productivity.

title: Behind the Scenes at CES 2026: Intelligent Product Lifecycle with PTC
summary: This article discusses how PTC, a software company specializing in product lifecycle management, is leveraging AI to transform product development and manufacturing. Steve Dertien of PTC highlights how AI can free engineers from time-consuming change management tasks to focus on innovation, optimize supply chains, and accelerate time to market. The piece emphasizes the importance of data quality, process reevaluation, and organizational change for companies adopting AI in their product development strategies.

title: Assessing Astera Labs (ALAB) Valuation After Analyst Optimism On Scorpio X And NVLink Fusion
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) has seen a 7.9% share price gain since New Year's Eve, driven by analyst optimism regarding its Scorpio X revenue and upcoming products like larger switches and NVLink Fusion. While the company is considered undervalued at $162.61 against an analyst target of $197.26, its P/E ratio of 138.1x is significantly higher than peers, suggesting potential valuation risk if growth expectations aren't met. The article highlights the importance of UALink adoption for long-term growth but also cautions about risks from cooling hyperscaler AI capital expenditure or rival solutions.

title: Apple will use Google’s Gemini models to power new Siri release
summary: Apple Inc. has announced a multi-year partnership with Google LLC to integrate Google's Gemini series of large language models into its Siri voice assistant. The upgraded Siri, part of Apple's new AI suite called Apple Intelligence, is expected to provide more personalized responses and handle multi-step tasks across various apps, rolling out later this year. This collaboration has also reportedly pushed Alphabet Inc.'s market capitalization above $4 trillion, making it the fourth company to reach this milestone.

title: Caterpillar Launches AI Assistant for Equipment Management
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has introduced Cat AI Assistant at CES 2026, marking its entry into AI-powered fleet management for heavy equipment. This new conversational AI tool aims to streamline equipment operations by linking Caterpillar's digital applications into a single interface. The system will provide predictive maintenance, step-by-step repair guidance for technicians, and real-time in-cab coaching for operators, addressing skilled labor shortages in construction.

title: Nvidia, Eli Lilly to spend $1 billion over five years on joint research lab
summary: Nvidia and Eli Lilly announced a joint research lab in the San Francisco Bay area, investing $1 billion over five years. The lab will utilize Nvidia's Vera Rubin AI chips to develop new treatments, building on Lilly's previous investment in Nvidia's AI supercomputer. Researchers from both companies will collaborate to generate data and train biotechnology AI models, with Nvidia also releasing new AI models for drug development.

title: The Autonomous Trucking Stock Investors Overlook
summary: The article discusses Aurora Innovation (NASDAQ: AUR), an autonomous trucking company held in Cathie Wood's Ark Autonomous Technology & Robotics ETF. Aurora aims to address challenges in the freight industry like driver shortages and high costs by developing self-driving trucks, with operations already approved between Dallas and Houston. While the company is in an early stage with significant losses, it has $1.6 billion in cash to fund operations until mid-2027, making it a speculative but potentially high-growth investment in a rapidly expanding industry.

title: Nvidia partners with Lilly to launch $1B AI drug discovery lab
summary: Nvidia and Eli Lilly have partnered to invest $1 billion over five years to establish an AI co-innovation lab in the San Francisco Bay Area. This lab will integrate Lilly's scientific expertise with Nvidia's AI engineering to develop large datasets and powerful AI models, utilizing Nvidia's BioNeMo platform and their next-gen Vera Rubin AI chips. The initiative aims to significantly accelerate the drug research and development process, building on Lilly's previous plans to use Nvidia's Blackwell Ultra GPUs for a supercomputer dedicated to drug discovery.

title: Cisco stock slips as Supreme Court case and inflation data loom — what to know about CSCO
summary: Cisco shares (CSCO.O) experienced a slight decline in trading due to ongoing attention on a U.S. Supreme Court review concerning a human-rights lawsuit and anticipation of upcoming U.S. inflation data. Investors are closely monitoring these developments, alongside Cisco's dividend schedule and next earnings report on Feb. 11, which will provide insight into demand signals and guidance. The company is actively promoting its role in the "new era of AI innovation," emphasizing its networking, security, and monitoring software contributions.

title: Apple calls on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
summary: Apple is partnering with Google to integrate Google's Gemini AI technology into its "Apple Intelligence" suite for the iPhone and other products. This collaboration aims to enhance Siri and other AI features, addressing Apple's previous delays in the AI race. The deal is seen as a significant validation for Google, whose parent company, Alphabet, recently surpassed Apple in market value, driven by its AI advancements.

title: Sizing Up Whether The Global Select Equity ETF Is A Buy Right Now
summary: The JPMorgan Global Select Equity ETF (JGLO) launched in September 2023 with $7.1 billion in assets and a 0.47% expense ratio. The ETF, which has gained 15% over the past year, is heavily concentrated in six mega-cap tech stocks, holding over a quarter of its assets in NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta. This concentration creates vulnerability if global equity returns broaden beyond U.S. mega-caps, exemplified by its underperformance against the iShares MSCI ACWI ETF in early 2026.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Ray Dalio, Chris Rokos, Steven Cohen, Bill Ackman, Israel Englander, Scott Bessent, Citadel Investment Group, Eisler Capital, Virco Mfg Corp (VIRC), Annexon Inc (ANNX), and More
summary: This article compiles recent news related to hedge funds and insider trading, featuring prominent figures like Ray Dalio, Steven Cohen, and Bill Ackman. It highlights various activities, including investment strategies, fund performance, and significant insider transactions in companies like Virco Mfg Corp (VIRC) and Annexon Inc (ANNX). The report also touches upon specific market movements and financial news from across the industry.

title: Form 424B2 GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP INC
summary: This SEC filing (Form 424B2) from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. details a new offering of Callable Equity-Linked Notes due February 2, 2029, guaranteed by The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. The notes do not bear interest and their maturity payment is linked to the performance of the lesser performing stock among Tesla, Meta Platforms, and NVIDIA. Goldman Sachs has the option to redeem the notes on various "call payment dates" beginning in February 2027.

title: Nvidia and Eli Lilly launch Co-Innovation AI Lab to advance drug discovery
summary: Nvidia and Eli Lilly have partnered to create a new AI-focused co-innovation lab in the San Francisco Bay Area, aiming to accelerate drug discovery and development. The lab will combine Lilly's medical expertise with Nvidia's AI and computing capabilities, leveraging Nvidia's BioNeMo platform for developing AI models and pioneering robotics in pharmaceutical research. Both companies plan to invest up to $1 billion over five years to support this initiative, which is expected to transform drug discovery, enabling faster and more efficient medicine development.

title: Caterpillar stock hits all-time high at $627.75
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) stock reached an all-time high of $627.75, reflecting a 78.62% increase over the past year and a 53.15% surge in the last six months. This surge in price and a P/E ratio of 32.09 indicate strong investor confidence, despite CAT appearing overvalued compared to its InvestingPro Fair Value. The company continues to demonstrate financial stability with 56 consecutive years of dividend payments and is implementing strategic initiatives like AI integration and leadership changes.

title: Why Alphabet (GOOGL) stock is up today: Google shares jump over 1% as Alphabet becomes the fourth company
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) shares surged over 1% on January 12, 2026, pushing its market capitalization beyond $4 trillion for the first time, making it the fourth company to reach this milestone. This rally is primarily driven by a multi-year AI partnership with Apple, making Google's Gemini the AI backbone for Siri, along with strong Google Cloud growth and successful Gemini 3 model rollout. The company has also surpassed Apple in total market value for the first time since 2019, reflecting renewed investor confidence in its AI and cloud strategies.

title: Google-Parent Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Alphabet's market capitalization briefly surpassed $4 trillion, making it the latest tech company to hit this valuation, driven by optimism over its AI advancements. This surge follows the successful launch of its Gemini 3 model and Apple's decision to integrate Gemini into Siri. Alphabet joins Nvidia above the $4 trillion mark, while Apple and Microsoft have fallen slightly below it.

title: The Smartest Way to Invest $2,000 If You Believe in AI's Next Wave
summary: This article explores investment opportunities in the next wave of AI, specifically focusing on agentic and physical AI as highlighted by Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang. It suggests investing in companies like Uber Technologies or Nebius Group for exposure to autonomous driving and data centers, while also mentioning the broader AI market. The author discusses current market sentiment on AI valuations and emphasizes the need for data centers to power AI's future.

title: AlphaTON expands exposure to decentralized Telegram-based Cocoon AI with NVIDIA deal
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp (Nasdaq: ATON) has secured a $46 million compute infrastructure deal to scale the decentralized, Telegram-native Cocoon AI network, which compensates users in Toncoin for GPU rental to process AI queries. The agreement involves acquiring 576 NVIDIA B300 chips, with financing through cash, non-recourse debt, and equity. Cocoon AI, built on the TON blockchain, aims to offer a privacy-preserving alternative to larger AI platforms like Google's Gemini or OpenAI's ChatGPT to Telegram's approximately 1 billion monthly active users.

title: Alphabet hits $4-trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet briefly reached a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by its intensified focus on artificial intelligence. This surge, which saw its class-A shares hit a record high, reflects growing investor confidence and follows the company surpassing Apple in market capitalization for the first time since 2019. The company's AI efforts, including its Google Cloud unit and the Gemini models, have contributed significantly to its strong performance and market leadership.

title: Apple’s TSMC Dominance Wanes as AI Demand from Nvidia, AMD Drives Revenue Surge
summary: Apple's long-standing dominance over TSMC is diminishing as the surging demand for AI chips from companies like Nvidia and AMD reshapes the semiconductor manufacturing landscape. TSMC's Q4 2025 revenue growth, driven primarily by AI processor orders, indicates a significant power shift. While Apple continues to reserve advanced nodes and ramp up its own AI efforts, the diversification of TSMC's client base means less leverage for Apple and a more competitive environment for cutting-edge technology.

title: Applied Materials stock rises on Susquehanna upgrade as chip gear spending call widens
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) shares rose 1.7% in early trading following an upgrade from Susquehanna to "Positive" with a price target increase from $180 to $400. The upgrade is based on anticipated increased spending in wafer fab equipment (WFE), with projections of $120 billion in current spending and potential for over $150 billion. Investors are now looking forward to upcoming CPI data and TSMC's earnings call for further market signals.

title: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia and Apple
summary: Alphabet's market capitalization surpassed $4 trillion in intraday trading, making it the latest tech giant to reach this milestone. This achievement is attributed to investor optimism surrounding its growing artificial intelligence business and the recent launch of its Gemini 3 AI model. Shares of Alphabet rose to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, reflecting strong growth of 65.4% last year.

title: SolarEdge (SEDG) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: SolarEdge (NASDAQ:SEDG) shares jumped significantly after TD Cowen upgraded the stock to "Buy" from "Hold" and raised its price target to $38, citing the company's progress in its turnaround plan. The upgrade was based on new product launches improving profit margins and market share, as well as strong initial demand for its new commercial storage system in Germany. This positive news follows other analysts also viewing the company more favorably, despite its shares still trading below their 52-week high.

title: Accelsius Closes $65 Million Series B Funding Led by Johnson Controls; Legrand Joining Round to Scale Liquid Cooling for Gigawatt-Class AI Factories – Company Announcement - FT.com
summary: Accelsius, a leader in two-phase, direct-to-chip liquid cooling for AI and high-performance computing, has closed a $65 million Series B funding round. The round was led by Johnson Controls, with strategic investment from Legrand, to scale liquid cooling solutions for AI factories. This investment will accelerate Accelsius' expansion, global reach, and the deployment of its proprietary NeuCool® technology, crucial for managing the extreme thermal demands of next-generation AI and HPC chips.

title: The Bull Case For IonQ (IONQ) Could Change Following Rapid Sales Growth And New Quantum Milestones - Learn Why
summary: IonQ recently reported significant year-on-year sales growth and achieved world-record quantum gate fidelity, alongside early completion of its Tempo system milestones and new international deployments. While the company is still experiencing widening losses due to heavy R&D investment, these achievements strengthen the case for its trapped-ion technology moving towards commercial viability. However, investors should remain aware of execution risks such as widening losses, ongoing dilution, volatile share price, and a high valuation.

title: Assessing Arm Holdings (ARM) Valuation After Physical AI Reorganization Into Robotics And Automotive
summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) has undergone a reorganization, creating a new Physical AI unit that groups automotive and robotics, while separating cloud/AI and edge products. This restructuring comes as Arm's stock has seen significant declines over the past three months and a year, leading investors to reassess its growth prospects. Despite being down, the stock is still considered overvalued by Simply Wall St's narrative, with an intrinsic fair value estimated at $70 compared to its current price of US$111.79.

title: SMCI Plunges 45% in 3 Months: Time to Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) shares have dropped 44.9% in the last three months, leading to an attractive valuation. Despite facing near-term challenges like contracting gross margins and negative free cash flow due to rapid expansion and customer concentration, the company is strategically positioning itself to capitalize on the AI market with high-performance servers and new product lines. Therefore, the article suggests holding the stock for now, acknowledging both its challenges and growth potential.

title: Natera (NTRA) Joins Forces with NVIDIA to Boost AI in Precision Medicine
summary: Natera (NTRA) has partnered with NVIDIA to advance its AI foundation model platform for precision medicine, aiming to improve diagnostics and personalized treatments. This collaboration leverages NVIDIA's computing technology to enhance genomic analysis efficiency and reduce costs, with initial results showing significant improvements in running time and training speed. Despite strong revenue growth and a solid balance sheet, Natera faces profitability challenges and its stock appears overvalued, with insider selling noted as a potential concern.

title: NVIDIA BioNeMo Platform Adopted by Life Sciences Leaders to Accelerate AI-Driven Drug Discovery
summary: NVIDIA has significantly expanded its BioNeMo platform to accelerate AI-driven biology and drug discovery, with new models, data processing libraries, and customization tools. Leading life sciences companies like Lilly and Thermo Fisher are integrating BioNeMo into their workflows, with Lilly launching an AI co-innovation lab and Thermo Fisher focusing on autonomous lab infrastructure. This expansion aims to create a continuous learning cycle, turning experimental data into actionable AI intelligence and scaling scientific discovery.

title: NVIDIA BioNeMo Platform Adopted by Life Sciences Leaders to Accelerate AI-Driven Drug Discovery
summary: NVIDIA has significantly expanded its BioNeMo platform to accelerate AI-driven drug discovery, integrating lab-in-the-loop workflows and introducing new AI models, recipes, and data processing libraries. This expansion is supported by major collaborations, including a co-innovation lab with Lilly focused on revolutionary drug discovery challenges and a partnership with Thermo Fisher Scientific to build autonomous lab infrastructure. These initiatives aim to transform scientific research by enabling continuous learning cycles and scalable, AI-driven approaches to understand biology and design potential medicines.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights NVIDIA, Alphabet, Amazon.com and CBL & Associates Properties
summary: Zacks Equity Research released a blog highlighting new research reports on NVIDIA, Alphabet, Amazon.com, and micro-cap stock CBL & Associates Properties. The reports detail the financial performance, growth drivers, and potential challenges for each company, emphasizing their AI advancements, market positions, and future outlooks. This daily research output aims to provide investors with comprehensive analysis ahead of market openings.

title: AlphaTON Capital Closes $46M AI Infrastructure Expansion to
summary: AlphaTON Capital has announced a $46 million AI infrastructure expansion to address the demand for confidential compute, involving the deployment of 576 NVIDIA B300 chips. This deal is projected to deliver a 27% IRR and 3.82x equity multiple, focusing on privacy-preserving, decentralized AI infrastructure through its integration with Telegram's ecosystem and Cocoon AI. The company aims to provide alternatives to Big Tech infrastructure for AI workloads requiring data sovereignty and privacy.

title: NVIDIA and Lilly Announce Co-Innovation AI Lab to Reinvent Drug Discovery in the Age of AI
summary: NVIDIA and Eli Lilly and Company have announced a first-of-its-kind AI co-innovation lab aimed at transforming drug discovery. The two companies plan to invest up to $1 billion over five years, combining Lilly's expertise in medicine with NVIDIA's AI leadership. The lab will develop a continuous learning system using AI-assisted experimentation, focusing on building next-generation foundation models for biology and chemistry, and expanding into clinical development, manufacturing, and commercial operations.

title: Nvidia to Invest $1 Billion in AI Drug Laboratory With Eli Lilly
summary: Nvidia Corp. plans to invest $1 billion over five years in a new artificial intelligence drug laboratory in Silicon Valley, partnering with Eli Lilly & Co. The goal is to accelerate the application of AI in the pharmaceutical industry by bringing Lilly's expertise closer to the hub of AI innovation. The project is described as a joint investment between the two companies.

title: Array Technologies and TAT Technologies have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Equity Research has named Array Technologies (ARRY) as its Bull of the Day, citing its strong market position in the solar industry, favorable risk-to-reward ratio, significant ROIC, and attractive valuation. Conversely, TAT Technologies (TATT) has been identified as the Bear of the Day due to its stretched valuation and limited competitive advantage despite positive sentiment in the aerospace and defense sector. The article also compares Micron Technology (MU) and NVIDIA Corp (NVDA), concluding that NVIDIA appears to be a more stable stock with greater growth potential in 2026 due to stronger market expectations despite both having a Zacks Rank #1.

title: RedCloud Activates Early Customer Access to RedAI Trading Co-Pilot, Putting Agentic AI to Work in Global FMCG Trade
summary: RedCloud Holdings plc has launched an Early Access Program for its RedAI Trading Co-Pilot, an agentic AI solution designed to revolutionize global Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) trade. Powered by NVIDIA and Amazon Web Services, this system aims to close a $2 trillion global inventory gap by providing predictive insights and actionable recommendations for pricing, inventory, and sales. The program allows select FMCG partners to test the RedAI co-pilot in live trading environments before its public launch in February 2026, transitioning global trade from reactive to intelligent decision-making.

title: AZIO receives $100 Million worth of Government Purchase Orders, Advances $200 Million Regional Pipeline and Scalable U.S. AI Infrastructure Expansion
summary: AZIO AI has secured a binding purchase order for 256 Nvidia B300 GPUs, generating approximately $107 million in contractual revenue from a major governmental initiative in Southeast Asia. This success is part of a broader regional pipeline valued at up to $200 million and follows a recent merger framework with Envirotech Vehicles. The company aims to expand its scalable U.S. AI infrastructure and deploy mission-critical AI solutions for government, enterprise, and industrial applications.

title: Array Technologies and TAT Technologies have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Equity Research has named Array Technologies (ARRY) as its Bull of the Day due to its strong financial performance, favorable risk-to-reward ratio, and benefits from clean energy policies in the solar industry. Conversely, TAT Technologies (TATT) has been designated the Bear of the Day, with its stock trading near an all-time high amidst concerns of overvaluation in the aerospace and defense sector despite recent positive sentiment. The article also compares Micron Technology (MU) and NVIDIA (NVDA), identifying NVIDIA as having greater growth potential in 2026 within the AI chip market.

title: The VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) News: Weekly Fund Flow Statistics – 1/12/26
summary: The VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) has seen positive performance, gaining 1.7% in the past five days and nearly 55% over the past year. The ETF recorded net inflows of $39 million last week and approximately $4 billion over the past six months, reflecting significant interest, particularly due to the AI sector. According to TipRanks' ETF analyst consensus, SMH holds a "Strong Buy" rating with an implied upside of 11%, and its Smart Score of Eight suggests it is likely to outperform market expectations.

title: Digi Power X Secures $20 Million NVIDIA B300 GPU Purchase from Supermicro to Power NeoCloudz(TM) GPU-as-a-Service Platform
summary: Digi Power X Inc. has announced a definitive agreement to acquire approximately $20 million worth of next-generation NVIDIA B300 GPUs from Supermicro. These GPUs will power the Company's NeoCloudz™ GPU-as-a-Service platform, targeting initial customer availability in March 2026. This acquisition is a key step in Digi Power X's strategy to expand into recurring AI infrastructure revenues, providing on-demand GPU compute for enterprise customers, AI startups, and research institutions.

title: Digi Power X Secures $20 Million NVIDIA B300 GPU Purchase from Supermicro to Power NeoCloudz(TM) GPU-as-a-Service Platform
summary: Digi Power X Inc. has announced a definitive agreement to acquire approximately $20 million of NVIDIA B300 GPUs from Supermicro to power its NeoCloudz™ GPU-as-a-Service platform. These GPUs will be deployed in Digi Power X’s Tier III AI data centers, with initial customer availability targeted for March 2026. The company anticipates a positive return on invested capital within approximately 30 months from the deployment, supporting enterprise customers, AI startups, and research institutions with advanced GPU compute access.

title: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Quietly Outperformed Nvidia in 2025. It Can Continue Soaring in 2026.
summary: Seagate Technology (NASDAQ: STX) outperformed Nvidia in 2025, with its shares rising 225% compared to Nvidia's 39%. This growth is fueled by robust demand for data center storage products due to AI adoption, with Seagate's 2026 production capacity nearly sold out. Analysts predict significant earnings growth for Seagate, and despite its rally, the stock is considered fairly valued with potential for further gains in 2026 and beyond.

title: The Truth About ON Semiconductor: Why Wall Street Won’t Shut Up About This Chip Stock
summary: ON Semiconductor (onsemi) is gaining attention on Wall Street and among tech enthusiasts due to its pivotal role in the EV and power-chip boom, particularly with its silicon carbide (SiC) chips crucial for efficient power conversion and fast charging. The company is actively shifting from commodity chips to higher-value EV and industrial power products, supporting AI infrastructure not by making GPUs, but by providing efficient power delivery and thermal management. While not a "meme stock," its deep involvement in EVs, AI infrastructure, and industrial automation makes it a strong contender for long-term investors willing to navigate semiconductor cycle volatility.
